attributes.action: amend the basket of goods used in the calculation of CPI inflation, to more accurately reflect the real inflationary pressures on the British People.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The CPI basket of goods is not indicative of the most common goods and services purchased by consumers.  The basket of goods should be expanded to 10,000 lines and include the most commonly purchased items and services, including;

All fuels
All taxes, including vehicle and council
Cost of public transport

To name but a few.

British citizens are suffering because of this governments unwillingness to accept that inflationary pressures exist, and the government has amended the calculations to suit this argument.

The CPI basket of goods should be determined by an independant body, and based on quantative analysis - not government whim.
